intro: Erechtites carduifolius, commonly known as the common beggar's-ticks, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has hairy, rough stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped with serrated edges. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Erechtites carduifolius is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
